Title.evidence: Title: Randomised Controlled Trial of Ticagrelor vs. Clopidogrel in Post-CABG Patients

Intervention.evidence: receiving either aspirin plus clopidogrel (A+C) or aspirin plus ticagrelor (A+T)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcomes were all-cause mortality and cardiovascular mortality, measured over a follow-up period.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation methods and allocation concealment varied across studies.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding details were not consistently reported.

Result_Outcome.evidence: A+T was associated with a decreased risk of all-cause mortality (OR=0.47, 95% CI 0.31–0.70, p<0.001) and cardiovascular mortality (OR=0.50, 95% CI 0.31–0.82, p=0.006) compared to A+C.

Harms.evidence: No significant difference was found in major bleeding rates (OR=1.16; 95% CI 0.69–1.96; p=0.57).
